question: The contrapositive of the statement "If two lines do not intersect in the same plane then they are parallel." is
choices: If two lines are not parallel then they do not intersect in the same plane
If two lines are parallel then they do not intersect in the same plane.
If two lines are not parallel then they intersect in the same plane
If two lines are parallel then they intersect in the same plane
explanation: Statement: $p \rightarrow q$. $p$: do not intersect, $q$: parallel.
"If two lines are NOT parallel, then they DO intersect (not 'do not intersect') in the same plane."
